issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: webhdfs
components.description: WebHDFS: HTTP REST API for HDFS

fields.description:
Reported over the lists by user Stuti Awasthi:

{quote}

I have tried the webhdfs functionality of Hadoop-1.0.0 and it is working fine.
Just a small change is required in the documentation :

Make a Directory declaration in documentation:
curl -i -X PUT "http://<HOST>:<PORT>/<PATH>?op=MKDIRS[&permission=<OCTAL>]"

Gives following error :
HTTP/1.1 405 HTTP method PUT is not supported by this URL
Content-Length: 0
Server: Jetty(6.1.26)

Correction Required : This works for me
curl -i -X PUT "http://<host>:<port>/*webhdfs/v1/*<PATH>?op=MKDIRS"
{quote}
fields.summary: Error in Webhdfs documentation for mkdir

comments.body:
-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12513284/HDFS-2869-branch-1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +0 tests included.  The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1843//console

This message is automatically generated.
This was a trivial fix to make the mkdir url in sync with the others. Went ahead and committed the docfix into branch-1, branch-0.23, and trunk.
